title: New: Lōnue – Lon Wolfe
content:
I’m a sucker for a lyricist that knows how to conjure up a narrative.

Lon Wolfe, the debut track from Chicago’s Lōnue is as wonderfully soppy as singer-songwriters come. Is it going to storm the charts, or even make it’s way onto a host of other blogs? Possibly not, but in terms of its simplicity and honesty, you’ll hear few tracks this year that do it so perfectly. ‘So now I move from state to state / but every city seems the same / I feel the cold where you should be / Unending moments, I’m lost and free’.
